nodes.text: Losha Tarkon was a human female and the partner of the former bounty hunter T'onga. Tarkon and T'onga lived together on the Moon of Logal Ri, where they planned to live as farmers. However, after Nakano Lash, who was responsible for the death of T'onga's brother T'ongor, supposedly resurfaced, T'onga left to hunt her down. Tarkon attempted to stop T'onga from leaving, but was unable to change her mind.

Losha Tarkon resided on the Moon of Logal Ri alongside former bounty hunter T'onga as a farmer during the Imperial Era. Around 3 ABY, the notorious bounty hunter Nakano Lash resurfaced under with a large bounty on her head, attracting the attention of several bounty hunters. T'onga, seeking revenge for her brother's death at the hands of Lash, decided to take on the bounty and hunt her down.

Tarkon approached T'onga while the latter was leaving the farm, and asked her if she was planning to leave without saying goodbye, wishing to see T'onga alive at the end of the mission. After touching their foreheads together, T'onga revealed her reason for leaving while entering her starship. Tarkon reminded the former hunter that she promised to abandon her bounty hunting life and spend the rest of her days planting crops, as the farmer did not wish to dig a grave for the former hunter. Tarkon could only watch and cry as T'onga departed the moon aboard her starship to begin her hunt for Lash.

Losha Tarkon was a human female with pink hair, blue eyes, and light skin. Tarkon was deeply saddened to see T'onga depart the Moon of Logal Ri as the farmer did not want to lose her, pleading with the former hunter to stay behind and plant crops in the land instead.
Losha Tarkon wore brown overalls over a light-colored shirt, as well as brown gloves.

Losha Tarkon first appeared in the first issue of Star Wars: Bounty Hunters, a comic book series written by Ethan Sacks, illustrated by Paolo Villanelli, and published by Marvel Comics on March 11, 2020.
